sub_title: Head of Operations | There is no innovation and creativity without failure. Period. (B.B.)
summary:
An enthusiastic, pragmatic manager with several years of experience in the IT and automotive were I developed my passion for creating new businesses opportunities with focus on processes, quality and results. 

By being in the possession of an engineering and a business degree gives me a unique skillset which allows me to understand both business requirements and technical developments for business opportunities. This makes me an all round player with a successful track record in strategy, consulting, marketing and project management in different roles.

Outside of work I enjoy exploring the world from my motorcycle or just a good cup of coffee.

Operations Manager | Business Developer | Business Consultant | IT | Owner | Digital Landscape | Apps | Mobile | Innovation

projects.title: Loyalty Makers | Coaching on the job
projects.description: At the beginning of this year we introduced "coaching on the job". This means that there are several meetings with employees per year. The purpose of this is to use short, clear objectives instead of an annual meeting.

contributors.headline: Head of Operations | There is no innovation and creativity without failure. Period. (B.B.)

projects.title: ANWB Brandstore
projects.description:
The ANWB Brandstore makes the process for buyers of the ANWB easy and efficient when it comes to ordering their own branded items

My responsibility for the project of ANWB Brandstore was primarily the technical development and design of the platform. This project had two major challenges that were successfully achieved. 

The first was a creating a sync with Esize procurement software. ANWB buyers automatically had to be logged into the ANWB Brandstore through SSO (Single Sign On) via Esize, place their desired order and then needed to return back to Esize for completing their order.

The second challenge concerned a new feature for our Brandstore platform. This involved making it possible for multiple users to purchase together at the ANWB Brandstore so that they can enjoy volume discounts.

Introduction of the ANWB Brandstore was very successful and new features will follow later this year.

contributors.headline: Head of Operations | There is no innovation and creativity without failure. Period. (B.B.)

projects.title: Expansion business activities
projects.description: This project was about adding a business activity to the current activities of a major automotive dealer company in Noord-Holland called Martin Schilder. Because this dealer has sales in business vans, there was also a need for body-to-fit vans. This type of vans have not a normal loading space, but one that is based on the needs of the customer. For example a VW Crafter that is suited with a bigger loading space and a tailgate. These activities are sourced out to special body-to-fit companies. My partner and I wrote a business case for how to do these activities within the company itself. This business case included the adjustments that had to be made in the workplace, the studies that employers had to follow for working with tailgates and cranes, a market research of the sales of these special vehicles in Noord-Holland and a full financial overview included the future pricelist for customers. Our study showed that the return of revenue was within 2 years and that for every vehicle sold, 20% more profit could have been made. Unfortunately due to the beginning of the crisis in 2009, the company was not willing to invest in this project. I think that still at this moment there are opportunities for this project at automotive dealer companies.

projects.title: Firetruck Gelderland-Midden
projects.description: In the second year of the HTS we had to do a long-term project which involved engineering a none existing fire truck for the area of Gelderland-Midden in the Netherlands. The client who wanted this truck was the fire department of Arnhem and needed a new fire truck with 2 cabins, 3 compartments for tools and a crane on the back. Not only we had to choose the fire truck itself but we also had to engineer the extra chassis for carrying the 3 compartments and the crane in full function.

profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
App-vise is a young organization that is specialized in consulting, positioning, development and the implementation of mobile application and other internet related products. 

Everyone wants an application these days. But an application can do so much more than just being an information tool next to a website. We are specialized in making an application in such a way that it will be an extra tool for your business. Not only providing blue prints for new application but we can also deliver an upgrade to current applications. 

Besides consulting about mobile applications we can also build them for you if you don't have the time or the know-how. But a good application that is ready for the world will not be a succes without a proper implementation plan. The world will need to know that your new tool is out there for them!
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
Strategizing in a changing world: globalization, collaboration and transformation
 
In the 21st century, organizations aiming to obtain and sustain a competitive advantage need to achieve global efficiency and local responsiveness, while embracing creative solutions and worldwide learning. The Master’s specialization in Strategy & Organization focuses on these management challenges and is built around the next topics:
 
Globalization
 How can organizations successfully prepare, design and manage their international business activities? Topics include corporate strategizing and the design of multinational enterprises, diversification strategies, multi-market competition, downsizing, offshoring and nearshoring, re-locating production facilities and headquarters, and other major issues concerning corporate strategy.
 
Connected world 
How can organizations successfully establish and manage interorganizational collaborative relations, including alliances, mergers and acquisitions, and strategic networks? Topics include management decisions to form, manage, and evaluate strategic alliances, pre-merger & post-merger activities, acquisition strategies, and the design and management of strategic networks as a means to gain competitive advantage.
 
A strong focus on strategy and organization, particularly in international service organizations 

As a Master’s student specializing in Strategy & Organization, you will explore the challenges associated with managing the international activities of multinational enterprises and entrepreneurial firms acting across borders. You will be confronted with questions such as: which decision-making processes drive offshoring and nearshoring of R&D, IT and business processes? How do you choose the best location for your production facilities or corporate headquarters? What are the best strategies when gearing up for growth and expansion?

More information can be found on the website.
profile_positions.title: Student Master Business Administration - Strategy and Organization

profile_positions.description: During my time at the VU I was driving people who were in need of a chauffeur. This could mean business people who needed to work while traveling. Or people who were not able to drive due to injuries. It was an interesting job becease I met some very interesting people who worked at different levels and diffent line of job. From directors of Oil and Gas companies till veterinarians.
profile_positions.title: Private Chauffeur

profile_positions.description:
At this traineeship we had to work in pairs and our research for this traineeship was expanding current business activities. Martin Schilder is one of the biggest car dealers in the province of Noord-Holland and their activities included: sales, maintenance, renting, repairs, marketing, sponsoring, financial support. We were looking if we could expand these activities with ready to fit bodywork for business vans. This includes installing of tailgates, hydraulic cranes and installing other bodywork than standard. 
We made the whole implementation plan: from schooling people, buying parts, competition analysis, until adaption for the building. In our plan this activity would be making profit within 2 years. But unfortunately due to the beginning of the crisis in 2009 the board of directors were not willing to invest in this opportunity.
profile_positions.title: Traineeship

profile_positions.description:
With my traineeship at Martin Schilder Haarlem I did research in workplace efficiency. Their workplace was fitted with 30 people who were divided in 6 different groups working on 5 different brands. (VW, Audi, Skoda, SEAT and VW business vans). Due to the complexity of the tasks it was very interesting and a challange to see if there could be made a significant change that could boost the workplace efficiency. Because this would not only be beneficial for the company itself, improvement of efficiency would lead to better turnover, but also would be beneficial for their clients, less work on their car would mean lower costs for repair and maintenance.    
By conducting a MMO I was able to improve their workplace efficiency with 15%.  The biggest change was made at the transition between the workplace and the warehouse. By chancing the process of providing the engineers with parts, the company was able to reduce the average waiting time from the engineers with 8 á 9 percent.
profile_positions.title: Traineeship
